metadata.title: CVE-2015-6758 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The CPDF_Document::GetPage function infpdfapi/fpdf_parser/fpdf_parser_document.cpp in PDFium, as used in GoogleChrome before 46.0.2490.71, does not properly perform a cast of adictionary object, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted PDFdocument.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6758` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-browser-l10n - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-chromedriver - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106').
